title: Weight-loss drugs are best for the rich, says liver doctor SK Sarin - India Today
summary:
Weight-loss drugs are best for the rich, says liver doctor SK Sarin

Published On: Dec 14, 2024

Published By: Daphne Clarance

Liver specialist Dr SK Sarin emphasized that popular weight-loss medications should only be used under strict medical supervision, warning that these drugs are primarily beneficial for the wealthy due to their high costs.

  • Dr Sarin advocates for healthier lifestyle choices over reliance on medications for weight loss.
  • Weight-loss drugs like Ozempic (semaglutide) enhance metabolic processes but can lead to side effects.
  • Dr Sarin believes exercise and an active lifestyle remain the best methods for weight management.
  • Increased calorie intake can lead to serious health complications such as fatty liver disease.
  • Weight-loss drugs may have significant side effects, including gastrointestinal issues and rapid weight regains.
“The best method for most people is still to exercise, burn calories, and lead an active lifestyle.” - Dr SK Sarin
“These drugs are not a magic solution. Once you stop taking them, weight gain often resumes rapidly.” - Dr Naresh Trehan

In conclusion, both doctors underline the importance of sustainable lifestyle changes, as opposed to solely relying on weight-loss drugs which come with potential risks and complications.

Top cardiologist Dr Naresh Trehan's three tests to give you your health horoscope - India Today
summary:
Top cardiologist Dr Naresh Trehan's three tests to give you your health horoscope

Publication Date: Dec 14, 2024 | Source: India Today

Renowned cardiologist Dr Naresh Trehan outlined three essential tests individuals should undergo to better understand their health risks, particularly in light of rising heart disease cases in young Indians post Covid-19.

  • Urgency of timely health assessments due to increasing heart attack rates among the youth.
  • Importance of genetic sequencing to identify predispositions to cardiac diseases and diabetes.
  • Need for regular health check-ups to detect hidden conditions and monitor risks closely.
"These tests give us a health horoscope, enabling us to map out the trajectory of a person’s well-being. Your health is in your hands—act before it’s too late," Dr Trehan explained.

Dr Trehan emphasizes the importance of informed lifestyle changes and regular assessments to prevent serious health risks, especially for younger populations.

title: New study links paracetamol to side effects in digestive tract, heart, kidneys among older adults - Deccan Herald
summary:
New study links paracetamol to side effects in digestive tract, heart, kidneys among older adults

Publication Date: 14 December 2024, 11:02 IST

Source: New Delhi

New research from the University of Nottingham highlights the potential risks associated with paracetamol use among older adults, revealing links to increased complications in the digestive tract, heart, and kidneys.

  • Paracetamol, commonly used for mild-to-moderate fever and pain relief, may pose significant health risks to adults aged 65 and older.
  • The study indicates a 24% and 36% increased risk for peptic ulcer bleeding and lower gastrointestinal bleeding respectively.
  • It also points to a 19% rise in chronic kidney disease risk, along with 9% for heart failure and 7% for hypertension.
  • Data were analyzed from health records of over 180,000 individuals prescribed paracetamol repeatedly between 1998 and 2018.
  • Previous studies questioned the effectiveness of paracetamol, indicating it may not provide significant pain relief.
"This study shows a significant incidence of renal, cardiovascular and gastrointestinal side effects in older people, who are prescribed acetaminophen (paracetamol) repeatedly in the UK," said the authors.
"Due to its perceived safety, paracetamol has long been recommended as the first line drug treatment for osteoarthritis... the use of paracetamol as a first line pain killer for long-term conditions... needs to be carefully considered," remarked lead researcher Weiya Zhang.

The findings call for a reevaluation of the long-standing recommendation for paracetamol as a primary treatment for pain management in older adults, emphasizing the need for further research to confirm these results.

Indian Men Are At High Risk Of Developing 5th Deadliest Cancer - Expert Shares How To Prevent It - Times Now
summary:
Indian Men Are At High Risk Of Developing 5th Deadliest Cancer - Expert Shares How To Prevent It

Publication Date: Not specified

Source: Times Now

Despite increased cancer awareness among Indian youth, stomach cancer remains a significant yet underrated threat, particularly among men. It is the fourth leading cause of cancer-related deaths in India and often goes undetected until advanced stages.

  • Stomach cancer is the fifth most common cancer globally, with a higher incidence in urban India.
  • Early detection and lifestyle changes are crucial for combating this disease.
  • Some common symptoms include difficulty swallowing, belly pain, and feeling bloated after meals.
  • Risk factors include diet, tobacco, alcohol, and genetic predispositions.
  • Preventative measures include a healthy diet and regular medical check-ups.
“Stomach cancer's aggressive nature and the often vague symptoms make it one of the deadliest cancers,” - Dr. Arun Kumar Goel

Awareness and proactive measures can significantly help reduce the impact of stomach cancer, emphasizing the importance of early detection and lifestyle modifications.

Saturday fun, Sunday regret: What’s the worrying trend about ‘weekend’ drinking - The Tribune India
summary:
Saturday fun, Sunday regret: What’s worrying about ‘weekend’ drinkers is it has 88% Indians aged under 25

Publication Date: Not provided

Source: The Tribune

In India, a troubling trend among young adults has emerged, with 88% of individuals under 25 consuming alcohol, particularly during weekends, leading to potential long-term consequences.

  • “Weekend” alcoholics are those who drink heavily on Friday and Saturday nights but abstain during the week.
  • Alcohol sales have increased by 8% over the past three years, with one-fifth of drinkers identified as dependent on alcohol.
  • The average age of first-time drinkers has dropped from 19 to 13 years in the last decade.
  • Spirits make up 95% of the beverages consumed in India, raising concerns due to their high alcohol content.
  • Alcohol consumption in India has surged from 4.86 billion litres in 2020 to an estimated 6.21 billion litres in 2024.
“Over 88% Indians aged under 25 drink alcohol.”

This article highlights the growing concern of alcohol consumption among young adults in India and the implications of weekend drinking habits that may lead to dependency and health issues.

title: 'I'm a nutritionist and my two top breakfast recommendations stabilise blood sugar levels throughout the day' - GB News
summary:
I'm a nutritionist and my two top breakfast recommendations stabilise blood sugar levels throughout the day

Publication Date: Not specified
Source: GB News

Diet plays a critical role in managing high blood sugar levels, especially choices made at breakfast, which are crucial for glucose control throughout the day.

  • Combining protein and fibre in breakfast is essential for stabilising glucose levels.
  • Breakfast options suggested include vegetable-packed omelettes or Greek yoghurt with chia seeds and an apple.
  • Apple cider vinegar and cinnamon can naturally help manage blood sugar levels.
  • Researchers have found that eating earlier meals can promote better blood sugar control.
“Protein helps to slow down the absorption of glucose into the bloodstream while fibre helps regulate blood sugar by slowing digestion and promoting steady glucose release." - Michelle Routhenstein

In conclusion, focusing on protein and fibre at breakfast, along with mindful meal timing, can significantly contribute to stable blood sugar management throughout the day.

11 winter fruits to boost immunity and stay healthy this season - Health shots
summary:
11 winter fruits to boost immunity and stay healthy this season

Publication Date: October 2023 | Source: Health Shots

As winter approaches, it becomes crucial to strengthen immunity and improve gut health. Incorporating winter fruits such as apples, strawberries, and kiwis into your diet can be beneficial for overall health during this season.

  • Winter fruits are rich in vitamins, minerals, and antioxidants that support immune function.
  • Vitamin C from fruits like oranges enhances white blood cell function and wards off infections.
  • Eating seasonal fruits can help maintain gut health, which is integral to a strong immune system.
"The primary way fruits help with immunity is by providing key nutrients like Vitamin C, Vitamin A, folate, and phytonutrients that support white blood cell production..." - Dietitian Garima Goyal

To boost immunity, consider including these top winter fruits in your diet:

  1. Oranges: High in Vitamin C.
  2. Kiwi: Loaded with Vitamin C and antioxidants.
  3. Pomegranate: Rich in polyphenols with anti-inflammatory properties.
  4. Guava: Contains high levels of Vitamin C and zinc.
  5. Apple: Source of quercetin, which helps reduce respiratory infections.
  6. Grapes: Rich in resveratrol and Vitamin C.
  7. Papaya: Contains vitamin C and digestive enzymes.
  8. Pineapple: Rich in bromelain, which has anti-inflammatory effects.
  9. Banana: Good source of Vitamin B6.
  10. Strawberries: Packed with antioxidants.
  11. Dates: Nutrient-dense fruits that support immune function.

To consume these fruits effectively, consider adding them to breakfast, using them as snacks, or incorporating them into meals and desserts for a healthy boost.

title: People are living longer, but are they well? Study reveals the hidden cost of longevity of human health - Hindustan Times
summary:
People are living longer, but are they well? Study reveals the hidden cost of longevity of human health

Date: Dec 14, 2024 11:42 AM IST | Source: Hindustan Times

Recent research reveals a concerning trend where increased lifespan does not equate to better health, highlighting a significant gap between lifespan and healthspan.

  • The advancement in the medical field has led to increased lifespan, but the extra years are often spent in poor health.
  • A study published in JAMA Network Open found that the gap between lifespan and healthspan is now 9.6 years globally.
  • In the United States, the gap is 12.4 years, the largest among countries studied.
  • Women face a wider gap, spending 2.4 years longer in poor health compared to men globally; in Germany, this gap is 3.6 years.
  • Common issues contributing to this gap include mental health issues, substance abuse, and mobility-related conditions.
  • The study indicates a paradox where countries with higher life expectancies often have larger gaps in healthspan.
“While medical advances have successfully prolonged life, they have not necessarily improved late-life health.”

This study serves as a vital reminder that extending life is important, but ensuring quality of life in those years is crucial for overall well-being.

10 signs on your face and body that say your hands are not clean - The Times of India
summary:
10 signs on your face and body that say your hands are not clean

Publication Date: Not provided | Source: Not specified

Hygiene is crucial for good health, and there are often overlooked signs on your face and body that indicate your hands may not be clean. These symptoms, such as outbreaks and inflammation, emphasize the importance of hand hygiene.

  • Eye infections may occur from rubbing eyes with unclean hands, leading to conditions like conjunctivitis.
  • Skin infections can arise when germs transfer from dirty hands to cuts or scrapes.
  • Touching the mouth or nose with unwashed hands can lead to frequent colds and flu.
  • Chapped lips may result from bacteria and dirt transferring to sensitive skin from dirty hands.
  • Nail infections can develop due to germs under the nails, caused by inadequate hand hygiene.
  • Frequent acne may be linked to touching the face with unclean hands, which clogs pores.
  • Rashes or allergic reactions can be triggered by transferring irritants from dirty hands to sensitive skin.
  • Eczema symptoms may flare up due to contamination from unclean hands.
  • Stomach troubles, including food poisoning, can result from bacteria on dirty hands entering the digestive system.
  • Body odour can develop when bacteria from unclean hands transfer to clothing or skin.
"Proper hand hygiene can efficiently prevent health risks associated with dirty hands."

Practicing good hand hygiene is essential for maintaining overall health and preventing various infections and conditions that can arise from dirty hands.

Why bananas should be part of your daily diet - The Indian Express
summary:
Why bananas should be part of your daily diet

Publication Date: December 2024

Source: The Indian Express

This article discusses the numerous health benefits of bananas and their significance in a balanced diet, particularly for those with specific health conditions.

  • Fruits, including bananas, are excellent sources of vitamins, fiber, antioxidants, potassium, folate, and magnesium.
  • Bananas are low in sodium and high in potassium, making them suitable for individuals with high blood pressure and diabetes.
  • They contribute to muscle health, enhance mood and energy levels, and aid in digestion.
  • Despite their health benefits, bananas should be consumed in moderation due to their sugar content, especially for diabetics and those with kidney issues.
  • Bananas have a soft texture, making them easy to chew for children and seniors.
  • Consultation with a healthcare provider is recommended before making significant dietary changes.
“Despite their general health benefits, fruits should only be eaten in moderation.”

In conclusion, incorporating bananas into your daily diet can provide numerous health advantages, but it is essential to consider personal health conditions and consult with a healthcare professional.

Health News Live December 14, 2024 : Intermittent fasting for weight loss? Study reveals shocking side-effect that will make you think twice - Hindustan Times
Intermittent fasting for weight loss? Study reveals shocking side-effect that will make you think twice - Hindustan Times
summary:
Intermittent fasting for weight loss? Study reveals shocking side-effect that will make you think twice

Publication Date: Dec 14, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

Intermittent fasting, a widely-adopted method for weight loss, has been found to have a surprising side effect — it may slow down hair regeneration, according to a recent study.

  • A study published in the journal Cell indicates that intermittent fasting can negatively affect hair growth.
  • The research focused on mice under strict feeding schedules mimicking intermittent fasting, showing significant delays in hair regrowth.
  • Fasting mice took about 96 days to regrow hair, while normal mice completed this in 30 days.
  • The study highlights the shift from glucose to fat as an energy source during fasting, causing oxidative stress to hair follicle stem cells (HFSCs).
  • Antioxidants, such as vitamin E, may help mitigate the side effects associated with intermittent fasting.

"The diversity in human responses to fasting may vary based on genetics, diet, and lifestyle," said lead researcher Bing Zhang.

This study underscores the importance of considering the potential impacts of intermittent fasting on hair health, suggesting that individuals exploring this diet approach may want to balance fasting with adequate nutrient intake.

title: 5 reasons why beauty sleep is important - Health shots
summary:
5 reasons why beauty sleep is important

Published Date: Dec 14, 2024 | Source: Healthshots

Beauty sleep is essential for maintaining healthy, glowing skin. While you rest, your body undergoes vital repair processes that lead to numerous skin benefits.

  • Repairs Skin: During sleep, damaged skin cells are repaired and collagen is rebuilt, resulting in a fresh and bright glow.
  • Reduces Dark Circles: Adequate sleep enhances blood circulation, reducing the appearance of dark circles under the eyes.
  • Improves Hydration: Sleep allows the skin to maintain its natural hydration levels, keeping it soft and plump.
  • Fewer Signs of Ageing: Quality sleep boosts collagen production, maintaining skin elasticity and preventing premature ageing.
  • Manages Stress Levels: Good sleep lowers cortisol levels, reducing breakouts and improving overall skin clarity.
"Sleep boosts collagen production, which keeps skin elastic and firm. It also prevents premature ageing by reducing the breakdown of collagen caused by stress and environmental factors."

In conclusion, prioritizing beauty sleep not only enhances your skin’s appearance but also plays a crucial role in your overall health and well-being.

Putting diagnostic accuracy to the test - Ophthalmology Times Europe
summary:
Putting diagnostic accuracy to the test

Publication Date: December 13, 2024

Source: Ophthalmology Times Europe

A confirmed diagnosis of familial exudative vitreoretinopathy (FEVR) significantly enhances patient management and treatment strategies.

  • FEVR is a hereditary retinal condition that leads to abnormal blood vessel formation, potentially causing severe visual impairment.
  • Accurate diagnosis is complex due to symptom overlap with other conditions like retinopathy of prematurity (ROP) and Coats disease.
  • Recent research confirmed that 60% of initially diagnosed FEVR patients had misdiagnoses, highlighting the importance of genetic testing.
  • The study reviewed cases from 104 pediatric patients, with significant findings on misdiagnosis rates and genetic implications.
  • Genetic testing is crucial for differentiating FEVR from similar conditions and is recommended for cases with ambiguous presentations.
“Genetic testing can identify pathogenic mutations in genes associated with FEVR, allowing for precise differentiation from similar conditions.”

In conclusion, genetic testing emerges as a vital component in diagnosing FEVR, facilitating accurate treatment and long-term patient management while reducing the rate of misdiagnoses in pediatric cases.

title: Study links intermittent fasting to slower hair growth - News-Medical.Net
summary:
Study links intermittent fasting to slower hair growth

Publication Date: December 13, 2023

Source: Cell Press journal Cell

Intermittent fasting is known for its metabolic health benefits, but a recent study has found it may also slow hair growth, at least in mice.

  • Research indicates that mice on intermittent fasting had improved metabolic health but slower hair regeneration compared to those with continuous food access.
  • A small clinical trial suggests that intermittent fasting may reduce hair growth speed in humans, but effects are likely milder than in mice.
  • The study found that oxidative stress from switching fuel sources during fasting inhibits hair follicle stem cells (HFSCs).
  • Both mice on different fasting schedules showed only partial hair regrowth after 96 days against control mice who had full regrowth in 30 days.
  • Antioxidants may mitigate the effects of fasting on hair growth.
  • The study's small sample size and brief duration suggest further research is necessary to confirm findings in humans.

"We don't want to scare people away from practicing intermittent fasting because it is associated with a lot of beneficial effects - it's just important to be aware that it might have some unintended effects."

Bing Zhang, Senior Author and Stem Cell Biologist, Westlake University

This research highlights the need for further investigation into how intermittent fasting impacts hair growth and other stem cell activities in both mice and humans.

title: Experts reveal EXACT number of minutes you lose of life every time you eat cheeseburger, hotdog or drink coke - Asianet Newsable
7 Easy tips to get you walking every day - The Times of India
summary:
7 Easy Tips to Get You Walking Every Day

Publication Date: October 2023 | Source: Times of India

Staying active is important, and walking is one of the easiest ways to incorporate movement into your day. Here are seven simple tips to help you develop a daily walking habit.

  • Make it easy and enjoyable: Just put on your shoes and start moving!
  • Start with baby steps: Begin with just 10 minutes of walking.
  • Find a walking buddy: Invite a friend or family member to make walking more enjoyable.
  • Make it part of your routine: Incorporate walking into your daily schedule.
  • Turn walking into family time: Make it a fun activity with your loved ones.
  • Make it a mindfulness moment: Use walking as a way to relax and recharge.
  • Treat yourself after each walk: Reward yourself to create a positive association with walking.
"The best part about walking? It’s easy and doesn’t take much time or effort."

With these simple tips, walking can transform into a fun and regular part of your life, helping you stay active without much hassle.
